meanings.definition: To take for granted or without proof.
meanings.sent1: She is assuming that the sun will rise tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: I am assuming you will be at the party tonight.
meanings.sent3: Assuming the cat can drive, we might have a new chauffeur.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was like assuming the sky is always blue.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's assumption about the test was proven wrong.

meanings.sent1: The assuming student thought he knew all the answers.
meanings.sent2: She had an assuming attitude that turned people away.
meanings.sent3: The assuming cat believed it was the king of the jungle.
meanings.sent4: His assuming behavior made him seem arrogant.
meanings.sent5: The assuming look on her face gave away her secret.

meanings.sent1: We will go to the beach assuming the weather is nice.
meanings.sent2: Assuming you finish your homework, you can watch TV.
meanings.sent3: Assuming the dog can talk, what would it say?
meanings.sent4: The plan will work, assuming everyone does their part.
meanings.sent5: Assuming the train is on time, we will arrive early.
